content: I've long been wanting to rename this group to just "wg-async". The current name is a mouthful and while I think it had historical importance, I don't think it carries its own weight anymore. We can define the scope of the WG more clearly on the website / in a WG charter.
but I don't want to do this without warning :)
barring any concerns, I'll plan to make the rename happen in a week or so
it would be done in such a way that old URLs for everything continue to work
There's exactly one reason I can think of to not do this.
async-foundations is, for want of a better phrase, less confrontational/presumptive to the async ecosystem.
wg-async sounds like something with much bigger scope that far more people would go "hey why am I not being consulted?!"
I'm not suggesting that the work should be different.
But "foundations" does suggest a bit of a prioritization of scopes.

I tend to refer to it as the Async Working Group anyway, so the change makes sense to me. I think Josh Triplett makes good points too, although maybe we should try and pull more of the async ecosystem into the wg.
I think its a good idea. I think we have explained quite well the scope of what we plan to do and I think that is understood, so I don't worry about people over estimating our scope
Perhaps we could change the name simultaneously with rationalising the membership?
The Async Rust in 2022 blog post seems like a good place to announce the change, maybe say something like "we're changing the name to better reflect the scope of what we are working on"

I like that. I think it should emphasize that the scope of the working group isn't changing to include ecosystem crates, but that we do want to involve people in the ecosystem more by having something like a monthly newsletter
